best_practices: Use verb-noun naming pattern for clear command purpose
Limit positional parameters to 2-3 for simplicity
Provide sensible defaults for optional parameters
Enable command chaining with standardized output formats
anti_patterns: Creating one-off commands for exploratory tasks
Using natural language where exact parameters are needed
Skipping parameter validation for complex inputs
Neglecting help documentation for new commands

faq.question: Which AI tools support these slash commands?
faq.answer: Slash commands work with Claude Code CLI. Integration with Codex and Gemini requires additional CLI tools.

faq.question: How many parameters can a command have?
faq.answer: Recommended maximum is 2-3 positional parameters. Flags and options can extend this as needed.

faq.question: Can I chain commands from different skills?
faq.answer: Yes, command chaining works across skills when output formats are standardized and compatible.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using auto-discovery?
faq.answer: Auto-discovery only reads SKILL.md metadata files. No user data or credentials are accessed.

faq.question: Why are my commands not appearing?
faq.answer: Commands require registration with the Claude Code CLI. Run skill setup to complete registration.

faq.question: How does this differ from natural language prompts?
faq.answer: Slash commands provide faster, unambiguous access for repeated operations. Natural language suits exploratory tasks.
